cn:association.cn:title: Warren Buffett Archive
cn:association.description: Buffett Archive is the single place to find an all encompassing, curated collection of Warren Buffett video content and article features. This archive houses countless interviews, keynotes, and a full collection of the Berkshire Hathaway’s annual meetings over the last 10+ years. Testing Summary
cn:association.name: Warren Buffett Archive

cn:association.cn:title: Berkshire Hathaway Annual Meeting
cn:association.description: A series of scandals at Wells Fargo has Buffett defending Berkshire’s big stake in the bank. He also makes the case for his Coca-Cola habit, explains why he changed his mind on the airline stocks he once called a “death trap,” criticizes “financial helpers,” and reveals the stock he was “too dumb” to even consider buying.  Testing
cn:association.name: Berkshire Hathaway Annual Meeting

cn:association.cn:title: Market Data
cn:association.description: The latest data from the financial markets. Find stocks, commodities, bonds, futures and currencies on CNBC.
cn:association.name: Market Data

cn:association.cn:title: Mad Money with Jim Cramer
cn:association.description: Mad Money seeks to help people like you, who own stocks and feel like they're on the outside looking in, become better investors. To teach you how to think about the market like a pro. This show is not about picking stocks. It's not about giving you tips that will make you money overnight. Our mission is educational, to teach you how to analyze stocks and the market through the prism of events.
cn:association.name: Mad Money with Jim Cramer

cn:association.cn:title: Trading Nation
cn:association.description: Trading Nation brings together experts from across the financial world to capitalize on recent developments in the market.
cn:association.name: Trading Nation

cn:association.cn:title: Futures Now
cn:association.description: CNBC's "Futures Now," is the first multi-platform media experience entirely devoted to the futures market. Twice a week, in a fifteen-minute live program only available on CNBC.com, prominent traders focus on how to trade the news of the day using futures. From gold to gas to S&P, the "Futures Now" crew will teach you how to harness the power of the multi-trillion dollar futures market, and turn today's events into tomorrow's profits.
cn:association.name: Futures Now

cn:association.cn:title: Retire Well
cn:association.description: A weekly look at how you can make the right financial choices to retire well.
cn:association.name: Retire Well

cn:association.cn:title: Latest PRO news
cn:association.description: CNBC PRO is your all-access pass to CNBC’s premium digital experience. It’s a comprehensive 24-hour online destination that provides behind-the-scenes content and tools for active investors and business decision makers.
cn:association.name: Latest PRO news

cn:association.cn:title: Currencies
cn:association.description: Currencies, Currency Markets, News and Rates on International Currency
cn:association.name: Currencies

cn:association.cn:title: CNBC Special Reports
cn:association.description: Find CNBC Special Reports with News and Analysis on Investing, Technology, Real Estate, Breaking News and Special Events.
cn:association.name: CNBC Special Reports

cn:association.cn:title: The Big Crunch
cn:association.description: CNBC’s unique data-driven lens at the juncture of information that moves markets, money and culture.
cn:association.name: The Big Crunch

cn:association.cn:title: CNBC U.S. Highlights
cn:association.description: The top business news highlights from CNBC so that you don't miss a thing.
cn:association.name: CNBC U.S. Highlights

cn:listItem.cn:slug: Here's how much Warren Buffett, Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos lost in the stock market plunge
cn:listItem.cn:title: Here's how much Warren Buffett, Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos lost in the stock market plunge
cn:listItem.cn:summary:
On Monday, Feb. 5, the Dow Jones Industrial Average plummeted, and at one moment, fell nearly 1,600 points, making it the biggest single-day point drop in history. And as U.S. stocks slipped and slid, so did the wealth of the world's richest.

The fortunes of the super-rich, like Bill Gates and Warren Buffett, were hit hard on Monday. Bloomberg crunched the numbers and found that Buffett, nicknamed the "Oracle of Omaha" for his investing prowess, lost the most at $5.1 billion.
cn:listItem.cn:linkHeadline: how much Warren Buffett, Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos lost
cn:listItem.headline: how much Warren Buffett, Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos lost
cn:listItem.cn:shorterHeadline: Here's how much Warren Buffett, Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos lost in the stock market plunge
cn:listItem.cn:bodyTeaser: On Monday, Feb. 5, the Dow Jones Industrial Average plummeted, and at one moment, fell nearly 1,600 points, making it the biggest single-day point drop in history. And as U.S. stocks slipped and slid, so did the wealth of the world's richest.

cn:association.cn:title: Buffett A-Z
cn:association.description: Berkshire Hathaway’s annual meetings are a financial pilgrimage, drawing throngs of Warren Buffett’s admirers from around the globe to witness him and his vice chairman, Charlie Munger, take questions from journalists, analysts, and shareholders for seven hours in Omaha, Nebraska.
cn:association.name: Buffett A-Z

The fortunes of the super-rich, like Bill Gates and Warren Buffett, were hit hard on Monday. Bloomberg crunched the numbers and found that Buffett, nicknamed the "Oracle of Omaha" for his investing prowess, lost the most at $5.1 billion.

cn:listItem.cn:title: Opening Bell, November 16, 2017
cn:listItem.cn:summary: Daqing Ye, Jianpu Technology co-founder, chairman and CEO celebrating the company's IPO at the NYSE, and filmmakers Jessica Wolfson and Paul Lovelace, celebrating the premiere of Discovery Channel's series "Hot Grease" at the Nasdaq, ring today's opening bells.
cn:listItem.headline: Opening Bell, November 16, 2017

cn:association.cn:title: Squawk on the Street
cn:association.description:
Headquartered live on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange, we are there when the all-important opening bell rings every day. With our exclusive "Eye on the Floor" wireless cameras at the NYSE we take the viewer onto the floor of the exchange, right to the posts where the biggest companies in the world trade. In addition, our exclusive "Tick by Tick" charts track the action of every trade of every stock.

Our live market coverage doesn’t stop on the corner of Wall and Broad Streets in lower Manhattan. We also have exclusive coverage from the floor of the CME Group in Chicago giving our viewers the treasury, currency and commodity action in real time.
cn:association.name: Squawk on the Street

cn:association.description: CNBC.com

cn:association.cn:title: Opening Bell
cn:association.description: Start the trading day right with the ringing of the opening bell.
cn:association.name: Opening Bell

cn:association.cn:title: NYSE
cn:association.description: NYSE
cn:association.name: NYSE

cn:association.cn:title: 2015 Berkshire Hathaway Annual Meeting
cn:association.description: A newspaper expose has Buffett defending Berkshire subsidiary Clayton Homes from accusations it steers buyers into loans they can’t pay back.  He also backs large job cuts at newly-acquired Kraft Heinz, explains why he doesn’t “talk up” Berkshire’s investments, reveals his most memorable failure, and advises aspirational businesspeople to stay away from business school
cn:association.name: 2015 Berkshire Hathaway Annual Meeting

cn:listItem.description: Daqing Ye, Jianpu Technology co-founder, chairman and CEO celebrating the company's IPO at the NYSE, and filmmakers Jessica Wolfson and Paul Lovelace, celebrating the premiere of Discovery Channel's series "Hot Grease" at the Nasdaq, ring today's opening bells.
